intro: Phacelia marshall-johnstonii, commonly known as Marshall-Johnston's phacelia, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States. It is a member of the Boraginaceae family, characterized by its hairy stems and showy blue or purple flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky habitats and is adapted to arid environments. It has small, lance-shaped leaves and produces small, capsule-like fruits. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
